snippet: New reports confirm that formaldehyde can cause cancer, but it’s still widely used in consumer products and industrial processes.
abstract: Editorial notes that formaldehyde, widely used in consumer products and industrial processes, has been judged carcinogen by the National Academy of Sciences despite efforts of chemical industry to confuse the issue; says verdict amounts to vote of confidence in National Toxicology Program, interagency program that prepares lists of known and suspected carcinogens and that has repeatedly been attacked by industries whose products are affected.
lead_paragraph: New reports confirm that formaldehyde can cause cancer, but it’s still widely used in consumer products and industrial processes.

headline.main: The Verdict on a Troublesome Carcinogen
headline.print_headline: The Verdict on a Troublesome Carcinogen
